title: Command-Line Interface
descrption: Command-line interfaces provide a way of interacting with computer systems and is a common feature across many types of operating system platforms. [1] One example command-line interface on Windows systems is cmd, which can be used to perform a number of tasks including execution of other software. Command-line interfaces can be interacted with locally or remotely via a remote desktop application, reverse shell session, etc. Commands that are executed run with the current permission level of the command-line interface process unless the command includes process invocation that changes permissions context for that execution (e.g. Scheduled Task).Adversaries may use command-line interfaces to interact with systems and execute other software during the course of an operation.

related.Name: 4H RAT
related.Description: 4H RAT has the capability to create a remote shell.[33]

related.Name: adbupd
related.Description: adbupd can run a copy of cmd.exe.[36]

related.Name: admin@338
related.Description: Following exploitation with LOWBALL malware, admin@338 actors created a file containing a list of commands to be executed on the compromised computer.[150]

related.Name: ADVSTORESHELL
related.Description: ADVSTORESHELL can create a remote shell and run a given command.[29][30]

related.Name: APT1
related.Description: APT1 has used the Windows command shell to execute commands.[68]

related.Name: APT18
related.Description: APT18 uses cmd.exe to execute commands on the victim’s machine.[164][165]

related.Name: APT28
related.Description: APT28 uses cmd.exe to execute commands and custom backdoors.[149][134]

related.Name: APT3
related.Description: An APT3 downloader uses the Windows command "cmd.exe" /C whoami. The group also uses a tool to execute commands on remote computers.[151][152]

related.Name: APT32
related.Description: APT32 has used cmd.exe for execution. [117]

related.Name: APT37
related.Description: APT37 has used the command-line interface.[41][144]

related.Name: APT38
related.Description: APT38 has used a command-line tunneler, NACHOCHEESE, to give them shell access to a victim’s machine.[163]

related.Name: APT41
related.Description: APT41 used cmd.exe /c to execute commands on remote machines.[139]

related.Name: Astaroth
related.Description: Astaroth spawns a CMD process to execute commands.[120]

related.Name: AuditCred
related.Description: AuditCred can open a reverse shell on the system to execute commands.[64]

related.Name: BabyShark
related.Description: BabyShark has used cmd.exe to execute commands.  [142]

related.Name: BACKSPACE
related.Description: Adversaries can direct BACKSPACE to execute from the command-line on infected hosts, or have BACKSPACE create a reverse shell.[34]

related.Name: BADNEWS
related.Description: BADNEWS is capable of executing commands via cmd.exe.[83][84]

related.Name: Bandook
related.Description: Bandook is capable of spawning a Windows command shell.[110]

related.Name: Bankshot
related.Description: Bankshot uses the command-line interface to execute arbitrary commands.[66][67]

related.Name: BISCUIT
related.Description: BISCUIT has a command to launch a command shell on the system.[86]

related.Name: Bisonal
related.Description: Bisonal can launch cmd.exe to execute commands on the system.[79]

related.Name: BLACKCOFFEE
related.Description: BLACKCOFFEE has the capability to create a reverse shell.[43]

related.Name: BONDUPDATER
related.Description: BONDUPDATER can read batch commands in a file sent from its C2 server and execute them with cmd.exe.[118]

related.Name: BRONZE BUTLER
related.Description: BRONZE BUTLER uses the command-line interface.[94]

related.Name: CALENDAR
related.Description: CALENDAR has a command to run cmd.exe to execute commands.[86]

related.Name: CallMe
related.Description: CallMe has the capability to create a reverse shell on victims.[54]

related.Name: Carbanak
related.Description: Carbanak has a command to create a reverse shell.[106]

related.Name: Cardinal RAT
related.Description: Cardinal RAT can execute commands.[32]

related.Name: Chaos
related.Description: Chaos provides a reverse shell connection on 8338/TCP, encrypted via AES.[56]

related.Name: China Chopper
related.Description: China Chopper's server component is capable of opening a command terminal.[23][24][25]

related.Name: CHOPSTICK
related.Description: CHOPSTICK is capable of performing remote command execution.[52][29]

related.Name: cmd
related.Description: cmd is used to execute programs and other actions at the command-line interface.[9]

related.Name: Cobalt Group
related.Description: Cobalt Group has used a JavaScript backdoor that is capable of launching cmd.exe to execute shell commands.[166]

related.Name: Cobalt Strike
related.Description: Cobalt Strike uses a command-line interface to interact with systems.[8]

related.Name: Cobian RAT
related.Description: Cobian RAT can launch a remote command shell interface for executing commands.[95]

related.Name: CoinTicker
related.Description: CoinTicker executes a bash script to establish a reverse shell.[123]

related.Name: CozyCar
related.Description: A module in CozyCar allows arbitrary commands to be executed by invoking C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe.[14]

related.Name: DarkComet
related.Description: DarkComet can launch a remote shell to execute commands on the victim’s machine.[90]

related.Name: Daserf
related.Description: Daserf can execute shell commands.[93][94]

related.Name: Denis

Audit and/or block unnecessary command-line interpreters by using application whitelisting tools, like Windows Defender Application Control, AppLocker, or Software Restriction Policies where appropriate.[2][3][4][5][6][7]
